title: 104_hr1827
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Omnibus Transportation Employee Testing Act Amendments of 1995". It includes provisions for mass transit testing. The Omnibus Transportation Employee Testing Act Amendments of 1995 require mass transportation operations receiving financial assistance to conduct preemployment, reasonable suspicion, random, and post-accident testing of employees for controlled substances and alcohol use. The regulations allow mass transportation operations to conduct preemployment testing of employees for alcohol use. SEC. 3. Railroad carriers must conduct testing for controlled substances and alcohol use among safety-sensitive employees as per regulations set by the Secretary. SEC. 4. Motor carriers also have testing requirements. SEC. 4. MOTOR CARRIER TESTING.

The Secretary of Transportation shall prescribe regulations requiring motor carriers to conduct testing for controlled substances and alcohol use among operators of commercial motor vehicles. The Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall establish a program for air carriers and foreign air carriers to conduct drug and alcohol testing for employees in safety-sensitive roles. The Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall establish a program for air carriers and foreign air carriers to conduct drug and alcohol testing for employees in safety-sensitive roles, as decided by the Administrator. This includes preemployment, reasonable suspicion, random, and post-accident testing for the use of controlled substances or alcohol in violation of law or regulations. The Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall establish a program for alcohol testing for employees in safety-sensitive roles, including preemployment, reasonable suspicion, random, and post-accident testing for violations of law or regulations. The amendments made by this Act will be effective on the date of enactment.
